Visualization

Interpretation

In this case we can see the gender wage gap (in%) in the OECD's countries. This OECD's study explains that women are lower-paid than men because they have much more difficulties to progress in their jobs. This difficulty can be explain by the fact that most part of women are spending much than men with their children. Marternity leave and half part time jobs are also justify this gap.

This study of course takes into account poeple with the same graduation, age group, jobs and experiences to have a good comparison between the both gender.

  • For the OECD's contries the mean gap is almost 13%
  • The minimum gap is in Costa Rica : 0.0% in 2010 and 2013
  • The maximum gap is in Japan almost 34% in 2000

    • Discussion

    The difficulties of this project:
    • Ploting as i wanted my data with the scatter_geo
      • I needed the international ID of the countries of my data frame. I found thoses 3 caracters ID on the Internet because they are using in many programming languages. With a pandas package merge i was able to plot the data with the scatter_geo.

    • Found the all the data
      • For example for many countries in this data frame there were missing data i had to waiting for a data update by the OECD.

    • Export the HTML code of the plot
      • I tried for almost 1 week to use javascript for generate a HTML page for this project but it was complicated to find the good way that i wanted to show my plot. I found on the internet a code which help me to export my plot in a HTML page : "fig.write_html(r'C:\Users\Taepoong972\Documents\Neoma Curses\Second Quarter\Data Visualization\Last_assignment\Viz.html')" The scrip has been generate and then i was able to integrate my plot in the HTML project. I want to underlying that i spend almost 3 days to find a way to export my plot. I think with a better background with deep HTML coding and Javascript it would be easier.
